conclusion: Need to analyze current positions of objects and shadows to predict new positions and sizes based on light source movement.
Shadow A is cast by the object at the top center-left.
Shadow B is cast by the cake.
Shadow C is cast by the roll of toilet paper.
Shadow D is cast by the ring.
Light source is moving to the back right, meaning light will come from behind and slightly to the right.
Shadow A will shift further to the right and slightly downward.
Shadow B will shift further to the right and slightly downward.
Shadow C will shift further to the right and slightly downward.
Shadow D will shift further to the right and slightly downward.
Shadows will increase in size due to proximity of the light source.
Final positions and sizes of shadows will be more pronounced and shifted to the right.
